chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens
Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary:
The defendant Troy Alan Schiller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain full time employment as allowed through SSDI regulations.

Submit to DNA sample, unless previously provided.  Undergo any counseling per agent.  Absolute sobriety.  Submit to random urinalysis.  No entry into taverns or liquor stores.  Submit to domestic abuse and anger management counseling.    If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: from court reporter
Sentencing Hearing 2/20/17

Defendant Troy Alan Schiller in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Defendant Troy Alan Schiller in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and parties state appearances.  Parties have rec/rev revocation summary.  State makes recommendations.  Atty Tsai makes his recommendations.  DE makes statement on his own behalf.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.  WEDS form provided.  DE advised again of voting rights, appeal rights and felony firearms warnings.

Ct 3 and 4:  
4 years prison (2 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision) to commence FORTHWITH
Concurrent to each other and any other sentence
Conditions of extended supervision:
Same as the conditions DE had during probation
Mental health assessment and any other treatment
662 days sentence credit to be applied
DE is eligible for SAP but not CIP
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 20, 2017 at 10:45 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 13, 2017 at 11:00 am.
28 days SCJ, w/huber as condition of probation
Associated with Charge #4
Associated with Charge #3

records.addlTxt:
Plea to Count 3, 4 & 5.  Counts 1, 2 & 6 dismissed read in.  Court goes through questionnaire with defendant.  Defendant agrees and understands.  No contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  Attorney Woodard gives court thorough explanation of today's decision to move forward to sentencing.  Attorney Woodard advises court there has been lengthly examination of the case and defendant's file.  Defendant understands and agrees to proceed today.  State makes final statement.  Attorney Woodard makes final statement.  Defendant request time to appear back to jail to report.  Court imposes sentence.

Count 5:
$243.00 costs & $200.00 DNA surcharge, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan.
9 months in Sauk County Jail, with Huber.  Forthwith.

Court withholds sentence.
Count 3 & 4:
6 years Probation, concurrent.
Count 3:  9 months Sauk County Jail w/ Huber privileges, concurrent. 43 days credit if revoked.
Submit DNA sample, unless one has been previously provided.  
Undergo any counseling per agent.
AODA & treatment
Absolute sobriety
Submit to random urinalysis
No entry in taverns or liquor stores
Submit to domestic abuse and anger management counseling
Maintain full time employment as allowed through SSDI regulations.
$268.00 x 2 & $250.00 x 2 & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION) 

Felony admonishment.  
Paperwork handed in court.
Prelim. Hrg. waived, Rec'd copy of INFO/waived reading.  Stands mute to Count 1, 2 & 6.  No contest to 3, 4, & 5.  Proceed to sentencing.

Defendant Troy Alan Schiller in court with attorney Stanley V. Woodard.  Defendant Troy Alan Schiller in custody.  John Newton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State advises of waiver today and proceed to sentencing.  Attorney Woodard agrees.  Defendant agrees.  State gives joint recommendation.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 1.
Preliminary hearing on September 5, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Troy Alan Schiller in court with attorney Stanley V. Woodard.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Woodard asks for prelim.  Time limits cont'd waived.  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 5, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Confidential medical information

Defendant Troy Alan Schiller in court with attorney Stanley V. Woodard.  Defendant Troy Alan Schiller in custody.  John A. Newton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and State states appearances.  Motion hearing today re: bond filed by Atty Woodard.  Atty Woodard notes medical history filed by Dane Co just this morning provided to parties today and argues for lesser bond.  State responds against modification.  Atty Woodard responds.  Court denies motion for bond modification.
for Modification of the Cash bail amount

Pre-trial conference on August 8, 2014 at 10:15 am.
Return date on August 19, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Troy Alan Schiller by video from LEC with attorney Stanley V. Woodard and intern.  Defendant Troy Alan Schiller in custody.  John A. Newton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  DE does qualify for PD appt.  State requests cash bond of $2,000.  Intern responds.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $2,000.00 cash bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety at all times from both alcohol and controlled substances, not to go to bars/taverns/liquor stores and not to go armed.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 8, 2014 at 10:15 am.  Return date scheduled for August 19, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
